result.execSummary:
The defendant Xavier Henry Battle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $200.00 due on 09/28/15.  Balance payable at the rate of $100.00 per month, starting November 1, 2015 and on the same day thereafter, until paid in full.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

records.addlTxt: cancel per SO a.m. sheet; custody JASO 4/4/17
of JOC  & payment plan.  RTS.  Not deliverable as addressed.  UTF

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.   Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Hammer.    Count 1 amended to 1st offense.  MU. 961.41(3g)(e).   Court granted amendment.  Defendant plead guilty.  Joint recommendation of $75.00, plus costs.   Elements reviewed by the court with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights with the defendant.  Defendant understood.   Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the elements charge.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Court found the defendant guilty of amended count 1.  Defendant did not elect to exercise his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  $75.00, plus costs.  $618.38 total.  Pay $200 today.  Balance @ $100. /mo.  starting 11/1/15.  FTP =   Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. Must report for booking

Pre-trial conference at 08-19-2015 10:00 am.
